attributes.action: Use The £115million a week normally given to the EU to pay off the NHS' debts.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
*  The British people have not had a chance to vote on EU membership. The 1975 referendum was simply whether we wished to remain a part of a trading partnership.
    * EU membership costs us £115 million a week - money that would be better spent on transport or the health service.
    * The French and Dutch 'no' votes on the proposed EU constitution means that the EU facing the possibility of collapse. Britain should now distance itself from this failed economic and political experiment.
    * While we remain a member of the EU, we run the risk of being dragged into further European integration, for example the euro.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/publicdebt/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
